intro: Cladopus fukienensis, commonly known as the Fukien hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Cladopus fukienensis prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
